title: Adding and Subtracting Matrices
text: Given matrices A and B of like dimensions, addition and subtraction of A and B will produce matrix C or matrix D of the same dimension.\n$$A+B=C$$ such that $$a_{i,j}+b_{i,j}=c_{i,j}$$\n$$A-B=D$$ such that $$a_{i,j}-b_{i,j}=d_{i,j}$$

title: Adding Corresponding Entries
text: Since the dimension of the matrices are the same, we perform matrix addition $$A+B=D$$ such that $$a_{i,j}+b_{i,j}=d_{i,j}$$.

title: Adding Corresponding Entries
text: We will start by adding the top left entry of A, $$a_{1,1}$$, and B, $$b_{1,1}$$. What is $$a_{1,1}+b_{1,1}$$?

title: Adding Corresponding Entries
text: Repeat the same process for each corresponding entries to compute the addition of the two matrices, A and B. This would enable us to proceed to perform the subtractoin of matrices

title: Subtracting Corresponding Entries
text: Since the dimension of the matrices are the same, we perform matrix subtraction $$D-C=E$$ such that $$d_{i,j}-c_{i,j}=e_{i,j}$$

title: Subtracting Corresponding Entries
text: We will start by subtracting the top left entry of C, $$c_{1,1}$$, from D, $$d_{1,1}$$. What is $$d_{1,1}-c_{1,1}$$?

title: Subtracting Corresponding Entries
text: Repeat the same process for each corresponding entries to compute the subtraction between the two matrices.
